answers.author: Eric Johnson
answers.text:
I took the short cut and called Erin. I'm not aware of any government that has done the rolling approach but it would replicate what those of us who have used bienniel budgeting do in terms of preparing a second year's budget -- just every year as opposed to every other year. For a fast growing community like Loudoun County (home of Dulles Airport and a ton of businesses), I can see the value of constantly looking out at a second year in detail.

author: Erin McLellan
text:
My jurisdiction is looking into beginning to use a 2-year rolling budget.  Appropriations would occur each year but a second planning year would be shown in the budget document.  I was wondering if there are other jurisdictions that use a rolling budget as opposed to a true biennial budget that might be willing to share the key assumptions or guidelines used to establish the estimates for the second year for both revenues and expenditures.
Thanks
title: Biennial budgeting/2-year rolling budgets
